conclusion: Analyzing the projectile motion of the ball from point B to point C.

Semicylinder radius is 0.75 m; Point A is at the left end of the cylinder on the ground; Point B is directly above point A; Point O is the center of the semicylinder; Point C is on the semicylinder with angle OC = 53° from horizontal; Ball is thrown horizontally from B with initial velocity v0.
Setting up a coordinate system with origin at O, x-axis horizontal, and y-axis vertical.
Point C is at (0.45, 0.6) using the angle between OC and horizontal and given trigonometric values.
Point B is directly above A, so B is at (-0.75, ?).
Using the trajectory equation for a projectile, derive the equation for y at point C: 0.6 = y_B - g·1.44/(2v_0^2).
Derive the equation for time t to reach point C: t = 1.2/v_0.
Using the vertical position equation, derive: 0.6 = y_B - g·1.44/(2v_0^2).
The trajectory must be tangent to the semicircle at point C.
The slope of the trajectory at point C should equal -tan(37°) = -0.75.
Using the slope equation, derive v_0 = 4 m/s.
Calculate the height of point B: y_B = 1.05 m.
Calculate the time of flight from B to C: t = 0.3 seconds.
The time taken for the small ball to move from point B to point C is 0.3 seconds.
